arch:property.oc:show_val: mudbrick slump on either side (possible explanation for L59) ,possibly a foundation, door post found to the western edge. large stones also found on a similar alignment in L48, possibly a continuation of this wall.
lies below floor L50 and subfloor L52, may overlie L66 surface and L59 mudbrick wall, but both features too partial
medium to large stones 20-40 cm, consistent size with a few variants

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: 20-40 cm. medium sized stones. fairly consistent size with a few larger and smaller stones.
.6 m. wide (roughly 3 or 4 stones thick). about 2 stones deep., door post near the NW baulk, but no indication of a doorway.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area E / Trench 2 / Locus 53 (Locus)
